page.title: 02Food Requirements
page.content: A butcher's van travels around much of the district. Some people buy their meat from this. Others prefer to buy meat and poultry when they are in Bellingham, either at Kelly and Anderson or Walton's shop. We buy frozen fish and fish fingers from the shops in Bellingham, fresh fish from Hexham or from a van which comes from Eyemouth to Bellingham weekly. Fishermen can catch their own trout or salmon in season on the Tarset burn, North Tyne or Klieder Water. Most people have gardens and grow at least some of their own fruit and vegetables. The most commonly grown are; potatoes, lettuce, cabbage, cauliflower, Brussel sprouts, beetroot, leeks, onions, parsnips, peas & beans. Some fruits grow wild eg, crab apples, raspberries, blackberries & hazlenuts.
